messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] "Magic Farm," a game for PCs
messages.msgSnippet: There something called Alice Greenfingers that works on Mac and is ok after a fashion but it doesn t do much.  I bet I d like Magic Farm from the description.
messages.messageBody:
There something called Alice Greenfingers that works on Mac and is ok after
a fashion but it doesn't do much. I bet I'd like Magic Farm from the
description. Thanks for the link.

~Katherine



On 6/27/08, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> http://www.gamehouse.com/newsletter/
>
> There's a new game advertised from GameHouse. I have several of
> their games. They're great with customer service and all that.
>
> The new game is not for a Mac and Holly's too old, but if she were
> younger, I would get this in a heartbeat.
>
> Magic Farm
> Grow and sell magical plants in this colorful adventure that's full
> of fast fun. Help Iris earn enough money to search for her beloved
> parents by growing and selling a wide variety of enchanted flowers
> and charmed bouquets. A captivating journey through a wonderful land
> of fairies, foes, and helpful little dragons, Magic Farm is blooming
> with family fun.
>
> It sounds kinda like Harvest Moon, but less expensive. Maybe less
> reading.
>
> Has anyone with younger kids seen it?
>
> Sandra
>
>

messages.subject: "Magic Farm," a game for PCs
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.gamehouse.com/newsletter/ There s a new game advertised from GameHouse.  I have several of their games.  They re great with customer service and all
messages.messageBody:
http://www.gamehouse.com/newsletter/

There's a new game advertised from GameHouse. I have several of
their games. They're great with customer service and all that.

The new game is not for a Mac and Holly's too old, but if she were
younger, I would get this in a heartbeat.


Magic Farm
Grow and sell magical plants in this colorful adventure that's full
of fast fun. Help Iris earn enough money to search for her beloved
parents by growing and selling a wide variety of enchanted flowers
and charmed bouquets. A captivating journey through a wonderful land
of fairies, foes, and helpful little dragons, Magic Farm is blooming
with family fun.

It sounds kinda like Harvest Moon, but less expensive. Maybe less
reading.

Has anyone with younger kids seen it?



Sandra
